definition[0]: used to show that one number or quantity is being subtracted from another
example[1]: The payment will be refunded to you minus a small service charge.
definition[1]: without something that would normally be there, or that used to be there
example[2]: He came back minus a couple of front teeth.
definition[2]: something that is a disadvantage because it makes a situation unpleasant
example[3]: There are both pluses and minuses to living in a big city.
definition[4]: used to talk about a disadvantage of a thing or situation
example[4]: ‘Any minus points?’ ‘Well, the engine is rather noisy.’
example[5]: On the minus side, there is no free back-up service if things go wrong.
definition[5]: less than zero – used especially when talking about temperatures
example[6]: At night temperatures sometimes fall to minus 30°.
definition[6]: used to show that you are taking one number or quantity from another
example[8]: Net income is gross income minus income tax and National Insurance.
definition[7]: a disadvantage or bad feature of something
example[9]: What are the pluses and minuses of practicing law in the private sector?
example[10]: The car’s only minus point is that the engine is rather noisy.
